comment: Gives information on material, and allows you to try it yourself for homework. Then allows as much of a class period as needed for review & clarifications. Is EXCELLENT one-on-one; will make time for you when needed. Has very clear expectations on grading & homework, but is very understanding. Very kind and hard working. Overall, great teacher!
Very fair.  Always available before school fir extra help.  High expectations for students .

Honestly the worst teacher I've had in my three years at CCHS. She only will help during school hours if you have extra time, no mornings or afternoons. Tests and quizzes include a lot of info not gone over in class, and if you don't understand the chapter 100% just start praying to St. Albert the Great.
Hands down worst teacher I've EVER had

Run. Run fast. Run far.  All kidding aside this professor was a really bad fit for me.  I would never normally not like a person because of something they cannot control but her lisp makes lectures almost impossible to understand.  I find that she is very defensive and pigheaded in her teaching and is in no way flexible.

Single handedly destroying my chances of getting into a good college, but, hey, no big deal right? Try to get help but she's "busy". It's basically teaching yourself an entire course... you should probably just drop it now.

Expects students to be responsible for their learning which includes reading the textbook and working independently.  Very fair; students were always told which material would be tested. Grading policies are clear and she sticks to them.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. She is unorganized and unhelpful to say the least. She is constantly putting material on the tests that she barely touched in class and leaves zero to no options for studying. If you are not a good test taker do not take this professor, and she has a lisp.

Shes a great teacher. Her lectures were fine, just pay attention. If you miss a lecture you will regret it. I aced every test, but she is a very strict grader. Double check your graded work for her errors. Textbook is useless. The group project sucks.  If your math is rusty, brush up. It's not her fault if you don't have the requisite skills.

Definitely knows math well, but sometimes doesn't seem to understand that others may not know it as well. Attended all classes and did everything. Doesn't have any mercy with grading. No extra credit. Group projects are useless because in ours, another group member messed up and all of our grades were affected. Got an 88 in the class because of it.
Knows content well.  Very accessible.  Helpful when asked questions.  Very fair with grading.
Very helpful and patient with questions.  I was away from school for many years and had anxiety about math.  She helped me work through that.
Unless you have a clear understanding of math modeling, DO NOT take her class.
